queue.name: Production Postgres projects table missing 10 columns — site down
queue.description:
PRODUCTION BLOCKER. The projects table in production Postgres is missing 10 columns that the ORM model expects. Every GET /api/projects/ returns 500: 'column projects.slug does not exist'. Root cause: recurring bug pattern #8 — ORM model was updated with new columns over many sessions but create_all() never adds columns to existing Postgres tables.

Production has: id, user_id, name, description, color, context, created_at, updated_at (8 cols)
ORM expects: id, name, slug, description, brief, workspace, color, connection_type, github_repo, vps_server_id, context, agent_ids, mcp_server_ids, status, selected_model, created_at, updated_at (17 cols)

Missing columns (10): slug (VARCHAR 255 NOT NULL), brief (TEXT nullable), workspace (VARCHAR 255 default 'default'), connection_type (VARCHAR 50 default 'github'), github_repo (VARCHAR 255 nullable), vps_server_id (VARCHAR 64 nullable FK→vps_servers.id), agent_ids (TEXT nullable), mcp_server_ids (TEXT nullable), status (VARCHAR 50 default 'active'), selected_model (TEXT nullable)

Note: production also has user_id column the ORM dropped — that's harmless (extra DB columns don't cause errors). Only missing columns cause errors.

Verified via: docker exec db-gkk8kw0w4wowck80kk0k4osg-155120947812 psql -U hubllm -d hubllm -c '\d projects'
Other tables (users, chat_messages, vps_servers) are fine.
change: NEW FILE backend/migrations/003_add_projects_columns.py: Idempotent migration using SQLAlchemy inspect. For each of the 10 missing columns: check if column exists via inspector.get_columns('projects'), if not → ALTER TABLE projects ADD COLUMN. Use these exact types and defaults: slug VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT '' (then UPDATE projects SET slug = LOWER(REGEXP_REPLACE(name, '[^a-zA-Z0-9]+', '-', 'g')) to populate from name), brief TEXT, workspace VARCHAR(255) DEFAULT 'default', connection_type VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'github', github_repo VARCHAR(255), vps_server_id VARCHAR(64) REFERENCES vps_servers(id), agent_ids TEXT, mcp_server_ids TEXT, status VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'active', selected_model TEXT. Must skip on SQLite (these columns already exist from create_all). Log each column added.
After migration script is written and committed: redeploy via git push origin main. Coolify auto-deploys, backend starts, run_migrations() picks up 003, adds columns, production recovers.
queue.test: Step-by-step: (1) Run backend locally — migration 003 should log 'skipping' for each column (SQLite already has them via create_all). (2) Push to main. (3) Wait for Coolify auto-deploy (~2 min). (4) curl https://www.hubllm.dev/api/projects/ — should return 200 (empty array or project list), NOT 500. (5) Check docker logs for the backend container — should show 003 migration running and adding 10 columns. Paste the curl response and docker logs migration output as evidence.

queue.name: Production Postgres needs UUID-to-VARCHAR migration script in codebase
queue.description: Session 90: Production Postgres had UUID column types (from older code version) while ORM expects String(64)/VARCHAR(64). This was fixed manually via ALTER TABLE on the live DB, but there's no migration script in the codebase to handle this for future deployments or DB recreations. Need backend/migrations/002_fix_uuid_columns.py that: (1) checks if any PK/FK columns are UUID type, (2) drops FK constraints referencing them, (3) converts to VARCHAR(64), (4) is idempotent (skips if already VARCHAR). This protects against the same issue if the DB is ever recreated from the old schema.
change: NEW FILE backend/migrations/002_fix_uuid_columns.py: Migration that uses SQLAlchemy inspect to check column types on users, projects, chat_messages tables. If any id/FK column is UUID type, drop FK constraints, ALTER COLUMN TYPE VARCHAR(64) USING col::varchar, then let create_all recreate FKs. Must be idempotent — skip if columns are already VARCHAR.
queue.test: Step-by-step: (1) Run migration on local SQLite — should skip (no UUID columns). (2) Verify backend starts cleanly. (3) Check migration logs show '002' running and skipping. Paste migration output as evidence.
queue.completion_note: Created backend/migrations/002_fix_uuid_columns.py. Uses SQLAlchemy inspect to check column types on ORM tables. If UUID found: drops FK constraints (projects_vps_server_id_fkey, chat_messages_project_id_fkey), then ALTERs columns to VARCHAR(64) USING col::varchar. Idempotent — skips if no UUID columns found. Skips entirely on SQLite (no UUID type). Test evidence: python3 migration test outputs '  [002] Not Postgres (SQLite), skipping UUID fix'. Updated CODEBASE_INDEX migration list and recurring bug #16 status.

_templates._note: These templates are the REQUIRED format. Both Director and Engineer must follow them exactly.

new_task._when: Director creates this when writing a new task
new_task.name: Short descriptive name
new_task.description: Root cause analysis with file paths and line numbers from CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml. Include learnings session refs. Be specific.
change: file/path.ext line N: specific change description
file/path.ext line N: specific change description
new_task.test: Step-by-step: (1) do X, (2) expect Y. REQUIRED: specify what output to paste in completion_note as evidence.
new_task.investigation_id: INV-XX or null if no investigation was needed

engineer_signoff._filled_by: Lead Engineer when task is done
_rules: completion_note MUST be 30+ words with file paths and test evidence
All checklist items MUST be true
If task test field says 'paste X', you MUST paste X in completion_note
engineer_signoff.completion_note: Changed [files]. Fixed [what]. Test evidence: [paste actual output — sqlite3 results, curl responses, browser console, etc]. Affected areas: [what else might be impacted].

_rules: Check completion_note has test evidence (not just description)
Check status was set to pending_review (not done/completed)
Check CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml was updated: git log -3 -- harness/CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml
Check all checklist items are true
Spot-check one file's line count against index entry
REJECT if any check fails — set status back to pending with rejection_note
director_review.review_notes: Verified: [what was checked]. Index commit: [hash]. Test evidence confirmed: [what was verified].

completed_task._note: This is what goes in the 'completed' array. PRESERVE all fields — never strip down to just id/name/date.
